clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Pessary vs. Vaginal Progesterone for Preventing Premature Birth in IVF Twin Pregnancies
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Cervical Pessary Versus Vaginal Progesterone for Preventing Premature Birth in IVF Twin Pregnancies: a Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: To compare the effectiveness of cervical pessary (Arabin) and vaginal progesterone for preventing premature birth in twin pregnancies after IVF

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a randomized controlled trial.
Women with twin pregnancies after IVF treatment, at 16-22 weeks of gestation, will be invited to participate into the study.
Subjects meeting the study criteria will be randomized into two groups: (1) treated with cervical pessary (Arabin) or (2) treated with 400mg vaginal progesterone, once daily from 16-22 weeks to 36 6/7 weeks.
Sample size: 520 participants

primary_outcome.measure: Preterm birth before 34 weeks of gestation
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients giving birth before 34 weeks of gestation divided by total number of patients per arm

secondary_outcome.description: Number of babies with respiratory distress syndrome divided by total number babies born per arm
Number of babies with necrotising enterocolitis divided by total number babies born per arm
Number of neonatal dead divided by total number of live born babies per arm
Number of patients with complains for vaginal discharge divided to total number of women per arm

arm_group.description: Cervical pessary (Arabin) will be inserted to participants at 16-22 weeks and removed at 33 6/7 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort.

Vaginal progesterone (Cyclogest 400 mg) once a day will be used, from 16-22 to 33 6/7 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort.

intervention.description: Arabin (cervical pessary) will be inserted at 16-22 weeks and removed at 33 6/7 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort

Vaginal progesterone (Cyclogest 400 mg) once a day will be used, from 16-22 to 33 6/7 weeks of pregnancy or in case of premature rupture of membranes, signs of preterm labour or patient severe discomfort

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
To be eligible for enrolment into this trial, each female subject must fulfil all of the following criteria at the start of enrolment, unless specified otherwise:
- Twin (mono- or dichorionic) pregnancy.
- Cervical length (measured at 16-22 weeks of gestation) < 38 mm.
- Willing to participate in the study
Exclusion Criteria:
To be eligible for enrolment in this study each subject must not meet any of the following criteria:
- Cervical cerclage in place
. Stillbirth or major congenital abnormalities in any of the baby
- Twin-twin transfusion syndrome
- Praevia placenta
- Severe vaginal discharge, Premature rupture of membranes
- Premature labor / Premature rupture of membrane
- Participate in another intervention trial
